description:
The XenAPI driver will attach VDIs to the compute domU for the purposes of creating/resizing disks, injecting data and some other reasons. If nova-compute is killed in the middle of this process, or the domU is shutdown uncleanly, the VDI will still be attached to the compute domU.

This can cause a couple of problems:
- It can leave VDIs attached to domU which can make cleaning up unused VDIs difficult
- If this happens often enough, the maximum number of VBDs can be reached, preventing new instances from being built
title: xenapi driver can leave VDIs attached to compute domU if shutdown uncleanly

Author: Johannes Erdfelt <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Apr 26 23:25:42 2012 +0000

    Disconnect stale instance VDIs when starting nova-compute
    
    Fixes bug 989306
    
    If nova-compute is killed, or the compute domU is shutdown uncleanly,
    instance VDIs can remain attached to the compute domU. This complicates
    cleaning up unused VDIs, but can also result in reaching a limit on
    the number of VBDs for the compute domU, preventing new instances
    from being built.
    
    Change-Id: Ie56e0561aa02178d6718b74a87bbb591fa869007
